Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly type A; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of draped figure, possibly a female, with added red and perhaps white on garment, moving left; at right, foot and bottom of garment of figure moving left; below, one black band above reserved band and glazed area with possibly narrow band in white over top.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0616) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
